name: Oklahoma City Black Chamber of Commerce
address: 1015 N. Classen Blvd., Oklahoma City, OK 73106
description: Empowers Black and minority-owned businesses and economic interests across central Oklahoma by sharing resources, building relationships, and advocating for equal opportunity. They offer various programs and resources for business growth
services: African-American-owned Onboarding programs in Oklahoma consultation

name: Black Wall Street Chamber of Commerce (Tulsa)
description: A non-profit membership-based organization formed to promote the sound economic well-being of African American-owned businesses in Tulsa. They offer programs like the Nest Collective early-stage accelerator
services: African-American-owned Onboarding programs in Oklahoma consultation

name: REI Oklahoma (Minority Business Center)
address: 15 NE 4th Street, Oklahoma City, OK 73104 (This is a general address for REI Oklahoma; specific program locations may vary)
description: Provides professional business consulting services and technical assistance to minority-owned entrepreneurs to help them manage, sustain, and grow their businesses. They are partially funded by the Minority Business Development Agency's Business Center program
services: African-American-owned Onboarding programs in Oklahoma consultation

name: The Alliance for Economic Development of Oklahoma City (Supplier Diversity Program)
address: 100 Park Ave, Suite 100, Oklahoma City, OK 73102
phone: (405) 297-2581 (General Alliance number, may direct to specific programs)
description: Created the Supplier of Diversity Program to help minority entrepreneurs and businesses compete for corporate and government contracts, offering business certifications, mentorship, and accounting assistance
services: African-American-owned Onboarding programs in Oklahoma consultation

name: Build In Tulsa
address: 1100 E. 1st Street, Tulsa, OK 74120 (Shared space with Black Wall Street Chamber)
description: Focuses on developing home-grown talent and attracting high-growth Black entrepreneurs to Tulsa, offering business accelerators, mentorship, and coaching
services: African-American-owned Onboarding programs in Oklahoma consultation

name: Urban League of Greater OKC
address: 3400 N. Martin Luther King Ave., Oklahoma City, OK 73111
description: A partner in the Supplier Diversity Program, offering assistance with accounting services, financial statements, and obtaining bonding and loan products for minority businesses
services: African-American-owned Onboarding programs in Oklahoma consultation

name: Oklahoma Department of Commerce
address: 900 N. Stiles Ave., Oklahoma City, OK 73104
description: Provides information and resources for aspiring and established business owners, including minority entrepreneurs, and offers various certification programs
services: African-American-owned Onboarding programs in Oklahoma consultation

name: Minority Business Development Agency (MBDA) Business Center (operated by REI Oklahoma)
description: Focuses on creating opportunities for minority-owned companies to achieve new growth and pursue government-related contracting opportunities
services: African-American-owned Onboarding programs in Oklahoma consultation

name: Greenwood Chamber of Commerce (Tulsa)
address: 1100 E. 1st Street, Tulsa, OK 74120 (Likely shares space with Black Wall Street Chamber)
description: Serves as a resource for businesses in the historic Greenwood district of Tulsa
